name: activerecord-postgis-adapter
body:
The PostGIS ActiveRecord Adapter extends the standard PostgreSQL adapter to provide support for the spatial extensions provided by PostGIS, using the [RGeo](http://dazuma.github.com/rgeo) library to represent spatial data in Ruby. It provides:

* Extensions to the migration syntax for creating spatial columns and indexes
* Attributes using RGeo spatial data types
* Spatial queries
* PostGIS versions of some of the ActiveRecord rake tasks

See the README for important information on installation and usage.

For more information:

* See the [documentation](http://dazuma.github.com/activerecord-postgis-adapter/rdoc)
* Source code on [Github](http://github.com/dazuma/activerecord-postgis-adapter)
* Report issues [here](http://github.com/dazuma/activerecord-postgis-adapter/issues)
* Questions? Ask on the [RGeo mailing list](http://groups.google.com/group/rgeo-users)
tagline: ActiveRecord connection adapter for PostGIS, based on postgresql and rgeo
